text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that any goods to Northern Ireland from third countries (such as China or the US) must meet all EU product safety standards. Section 5.3, under the heading 'Example: a shipment from China \u2192 NI (direct import)', explicitly states: 'Because NI remains aligned with the EU customs territory, a Chinese-origin shipment that lands in NI is treated as an EU import.' This implies adherence to EU standards for entry into that market, which aligns with the requirement that goods must meet EU product safety standards to enter the EU market via NI.", "criterion_id": "e4a1ae1b-a58e-4d31-bec4-4cf261c4a1c4"}
